screen_desc: The screenshot shows the "Pop-ups and redirects" settings page on a smartphone browser. There is a toggle switch next to the option to "Block sites from showing pop-ups and redirects (recommended)," which is currently turned off, indicating that pop-ups and redirects are allowed. Users can enable this feature for better browsing security by preventing unwanted pop-ups and redirects. The page also has a search icon and a menu icon at the top right, indicating further options or actions that can be performed within this setting. The time at the top left suggests the screenshot was taken at 7:53.
action_think: According to the screen description and the user's request to turn pop-ups off in Chrome, the next step is to enable the toggle switch next to 'Block sites from showing pop-ups and redirects (recommended)'. Currently, the toggle is off, allowing pop-ups and redirects, which is against the user's request. By enabling this toggle, the browser will block unwanted pop-ups and redirects, fulfilling the user's request.
action_plan: Toggle the switch to enable 'Block sites from showing pop-ups and redirects'.
Confirm that the setting has been enabled and pop-ups are now blocked.
